basics.name: Sean Takafuji
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science and a B.S. in Mathematics in the College of Natural Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020.

volunteer.summary: Cybersecurity Club at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. Club activites include group learning over cybersecurity concepts, competing in CTFs, and networking with the local cyber community.
Student Chapter at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. Club activites include hosting technical events, special interest groups, and networking opportunities

The GenCyber Hawai`i program provides summer cybersecurity camp experiences for students and teachers. The goals of the program are to help all students understand correct and safe on-line behavior, increase diversity and interest in cybersecurity and careers in the cybersecurity workforce of the Nation, and improve teaching methods for delivering cybersecurity content in K-12 computer science curricula.

Camp Innovation is an annual week long summer camp that introduces robotics to elementary and middle school students. The goals of the program are to help students understand basic engineering and programming concepts.

awards.title: PyNight: Python Programming Competition Winner
awards.summary: My team won first place at a CTF-style Python Programming Competition. Part of Team "Azure"

awards.title: NASA Space Apps Challenge Hackathon People's Choice Award
awards.summary: My team won the Local People's Choice Award and competed at the National level

awards.title: Manoa Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.5 at a Hawai'i public school.
